subject: Data
title: The 1854 Cholera Map: Data Saves London
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The 1854 Cholera Map: Data Saves London.

hook.text: In 1854, cholera was killing hundreds in London's Soho. Doctors blamed 'bad air' from the sewers.

buildup.text: Dr. John Snow plotted every cholera death on a street map, looking for a pattern in the dots.

discovery.text: Deaths clustered around one water pump on Broad Street. The water, not the air, was the killer.

twist.text: Authorities removed the pump handle. The epidemic stopped. Data had overturned medical dogma.

climax.text: Snow's map is considered the founding moment of epidemiology and spatial data analysis.

punchline.text: A map of dots ended an epidemic.

quiz.question: What did John Snow's cholera map reveal?
options: Deaths clustered around a contaminated water pump
